sn2.15:4.1: Standing to one side, the god Candana addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.15:5.2: not slacking off by day or by night.
sn2.15:5.4: does not sink in the deep?”
sn2.15:6.1: “Someone who is always endowed with ethics,
sn2.15:6.4: crosses the flood so hard to cross.
sn2.15:7.1: Someone who desists from sensual perception,
sn2.15:7.2: has moved past the fetter of form,
sn2.15:7.3: and has finished with relishing and greed
sn2.15:7.4: does not sink in the deep.”
